title: Inflation

slides.text:

slides.text:
Inflation = prices rising over time.

‚Ä¢ Same money buys LESS
‚Ä¢ ‚Ç¨100 today ‚â† ‚Ç¨100 in 10 years

slides.title: Real Numbers üî¢
slides.text:
At 3% annual inflation:

‚Ç¨100 today = 
‚Ä¢ ‚Ç¨97 in 1 year
‚Ä¢ ‚Ç¨86 in 5 years
‚Ä¢ ‚Ç¨74 in 10 years

(In terms of buying power!)

slides.text:
Causes of inflation:

üì¶ Supply chain issues
‚ö° Energy prices up
üë• High demand

slides.text:
To preserve value:

‚Ä¢ Savings accounts (if rate > inflation)
‚Ä¢ Investments (stocks, ETFs)
‚Ä¢ Real assets (property)

title: Compound Interest
description: The magic of time: start saving early

slides.title: The 8th Wonder of the World üåü
slides.text:
Einstein (supposedly) called compound interest 'the 8th wonder of the world.'

Why? Because it's MAGICAL!

slides.title: Simple vs Compound Interest
slides.text:
Simple: ‚Ç¨100 √ó 5% = ‚Ç¨5/year (always ‚Ç¨5)

Compound: Interest on interest!
‚Ä¢ Year 1: ‚Ç¨100 ‚Üí ‚Ç¨105
‚Ä¢ Year 2: ‚Ç¨105 ‚Üí ‚Ç¨110.25
‚Ä¢ Year 3: ‚Ç¨110.25 ‚Üí ‚Ç¨115.76

slides.question: What makes compound interest special?
slides.explanation: Interest on interest = exponential growth! üìà

slides.title: The Power of Time ‚è∞
slides.text:
‚Ç¨1000 at 7% annual return:

‚Ä¢ 10 years: ‚Ç¨1,967
‚Ä¢ 20 years: ‚Ç¨3,870
‚Ä¢ 30 years: ‚Ç¨7,612
‚Ä¢ 40 years: ‚Ç¨14,974

Same investment, different time = HUGE difference!

slides.title: Rule of 72 üî¢
slides.text:
Quick math trick:

72 √∑ interest rate = years to double

‚Ä¢ 72 √∑ 6% = 12 years
‚Ä¢ 72 √∑ 8% = 9 years
‚Ä¢ 72 √∑ 10% = 7.2 years

slides.question: At 6% return, how long to double money?
slides.explanation: 72 √∑ 6 = 12 years! The Rule of 72 works! üî¢

slides.title: Why Start NOW? üöÄ
slides.text:
Starting at 15 vs 25:

Save ‚Ç¨50/month at 7%:

‚Ä¢ Start at 15: ‚Ç¨131,000 by 65
‚Ä¢ Start at 25: ‚Ç¨65,000 by 65

10 years difference = ‚Ç¨66,000! üò±

slides.title: Start your compound journey!
slides.text: Even ‚Ç¨10/month now is better than ‚Ç¨100/month later!

summary: You learned about compound interest ‚Äî TIME is your biggest asset!

title: BNPL: Buy Now Pay Later

slides.text:

slides.text:
1. See ‚Ç¨100 item

4. ‚Ç¨25 every 2 weeks

slides.title: The Trap ü™§
slides.text:
Problem 1: Multiple BNPLs

‚Ä¢ Shoes: ‚Ç¨25/2 weeks
‚Ä¢ Game: ‚Ç¨15/2 weeks  
‚Ä¢ Clothes: ‚Ç¨30/2 weeks

Suddenly: ‚Ç¨70 every 2 weeks!

slides.question: Main BNPL danger?
slides.explanation: Multiple small debts = one big problem! üí∏

slides.title: Late Fees & Credit Score üìâ
slides.text:
Miss a payment:

‚ö†Ô∏è Late fees: ‚Ç¨5-15
‚ö†Ô∏è Can go to collections
‚ö†Ô∏è Hurts credit score
‚ö†Ô∏è Future loans harder to get

slides.title: The Psychology Trick üß†

slides.title: Better alternative: Save first!

title: Insurance Basics
description: Why liability insurance is essential in EU

slides.title: Insurance = Protection üõ°Ô∏è
slides.text:
Insurance protects against unexpected costs:

‚Ä¢ Accidents
‚Ä¢ Illness
‚Ä¢ Damage to others
‚Ä¢ Theft

slides.title: Liability Insurance üî•
slides.text:
In EU, this is ESSENTIAL!

‚Ä¢ Spill coffee on laptop: ‚Ç¨1000
‚Ä¢ Bike hits pedestrian: ‚Ç¨50,000+
‚Ä¢ Break store window: ‚Ç¨500

slides.question: What does liability insurance cover?
slides.explanation: Liability = damage to OTHER people/property! üõ°Ô∏è

slides.title: Types of Insurance üìã
slides.text:
Common types:

üè• Health (often mandatory)
üõ°Ô∏è Liability (highly recommended)
üì± Device (phones, laptops)
‚úàÔ∏è Travel
üöó Car (mandatory)
üè† Home/Renters

slides.title: Teen Insurance Situation
slides.text:
Usually covered by parents until 18-25:

‚Ä¢ Liability: family policy

title: Stocks & Bonds

slides.title: What is the Stock Market? üìà
slides.text: A place where you can buy pieces of companies (stocks) or lend money to them (bonds).

slides.title: Stocks = Ownership üè¢
slides.text:
Buy Apple stock = own tiny piece of Apple!

‚Ä¢ If Apple grows ‚Üí stock value up üìà
‚Ä¢ If Apple struggles ‚Üí stock value down üìâ
‚Ä¢ Some stocks pay dividends (share of profits)

slides.question: What does owning stock mean?
slides.explanation: Stock = ownership piece of a company! üìà

slides.title: Bonds = Lending üí∞
slides.text:
Buy a bond = lend money to company/government.

‚Ä¢ They promise to pay back + interest
‚Ä¢ Lower risk than stocks
‚Ä¢ Lower potential reward too
‚Ä¢ Good for stability

slides.title: Risk vs Reward ‚öñÔ∏è
slides.text:
General rule:

üî¥ Stocks: Higher risk, higher potential reward
üü¢ Bonds: Lower risk, lower reward

Young people can take more risk (time to recover!)

slides.question: Why can young people take more investment risk?
options: More time to recover from losses
slides.explanation: Time = your advantage! Losses can recover over years. ‚è∞

slides.title: Important! ‚ö†Ô∏è
slides.text:
‚Ä¢ Never invest money you can't afford to lose
‚Ä¢ Past performance ‚â† future results
‚Ä¢ Diversify (don't put all eggs in one basket)
‚Ä¢ Long-term > short-term gambling

slides.title: Learn more!
slides.text: Next lesson: ETFs ‚Äî the safest way to start investing.

summary: You learned about stocks and bonds ‚Äî the basics of investing!

title: ETFs

slides.text:
ETF = Exchange-Traded Fund

Buy one ETF = buy piece of hundreds of companies!

slides.text:
‚úÖ Instant diversification
‚úÖ Low fees
‚úÖ Easy to buy/sell

slides.question: Main advantage of ETFs?

slides.text:

3. Set up automatic monthly investment

title: Cryptocurrency

slides.title: What is Crypto? ü™ô
slides.text:
Cryptocurrency = digital money not controlled by governments.

Bitcoin, Ethereum, and 10,000+ others.

Revolutionary technology, but VERY risky!

slides.title: Why So Popular? üöÄ
slides.text:
‚Ä¢ Bitcoin: ‚Ç¨100 in 2010 ‚Üí millions now
‚Ä¢ Stories of overnight millionaires
‚Ä¢ 'Freedom from banks'
‚Ä¢ FOMO (Fear Of Missing Out)

But... survivorship bias!

slides.question: Why do we hear about crypto millionaires?
slides.explanation: We hear winners, not the many losers! üìâ

slides.title: The Risks ‚ö†Ô∏è
slides.text:
‚Ä¢ EXTREME volatility (-80% in months)
‚Ä¢ Scams everywhere
‚Ä¢ No protection if hacked
‚Ä¢ Tax complications
‚Ä¢ Many coins go to zero
‚Ä¢ No underlying value

slides.title: Crypto vs Stocks üìä
slides.text:
Stocks:
‚Ä¢ Own part of real company
‚Ä¢ Company makes products/profits
‚Ä¢ Regulated, protected

Crypto:
‚Ä¢ Own digital token
‚Ä¢ Value = what others will pay
‚Ä¢ Mostly unregulated

slides.question: Main difference between stocks and crypto?
slides.explanation: Stocks = ownership. Crypto = speculative value only. üìà

slides.title: If You Still Want Crypto üé∞
slides.text:
Rules:

1. Only money you can 100% lose
2. Never more than 5-10% of portfolio
3. Stick to BTC/ETH (biggest)
4. Use regulated exchanges
5. Never share seed phrase!
6. Don't chase 'moon' coins

slides.title: Learn first, invest later!
slides.text: Focus on building savings before speculative investments.

summary: You learned about crypto ‚Äî high risk, only invest what you can lose!
